snippet: The Roman Catholic hierarchy said the White House compromise on health insurance coverage of birth control did not do enough to protect religious institutions.
abstract: Nation's Roman Catholic bishops reject latest Obama administration proposal on health insurance coverage of contraceptives, saying it does not offer enough safeguards for religious hospitals, colleges and charities that object to providing such coverage for their employees.
lead_paragraph: The Roman Catholic hierarchy said the White House compromise on health insurance coverage of birth control did not do enough to protect religious institutions.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
keywords.name: organizations
